Description: Body sherd of East Greek, possibly Clazomenian, pottery closed vessel, perhaps an amphora; exterior: painted decoration consisting of vine tendrils with leaves.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 209, no. N30)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.097) (phase 3)
